intro: Corydalis lutescens, commonly known as the yellow corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters and prefers well-drained, moist soils. Its flowers bloom in spring, and the plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Corydalis lutescens is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
